page.title: 11Coleshill,United church
page.content: The Non-Conformists church was built in 1900.It is now run by the Methodists and Congregationalists church,they joined together 14 years ago and are called{The United Church. To raise money they have jumble sales,coffee mornings and sometimes garden parties.At the harvest there are lots of children as some of the Brownies and Guides come.The vicar asked the children who had brought a gift,probably food or money to bring them forward,the gifts were divided,one third to the world poor,one third to the local poor,and one third to the{United Church Homes. It is a very small church without a spire or bells.It has a little Sunday school held in the back room of the church.The normal services are more for adults than children,it can be a bit boring.
